description: Change of use from postal sorting office (Sui-generis use class) to retail use (A1 use class), financial and professional services (A2 use class) and business offices (B1a  use class).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers  8578-EX- 009 Rev. A, 010 Rev. A, 011 Rev. A, 012 Rev. A, 015 Rev. A; 8578-PP- 029 Rev. A, 031 Rev A, 032 Rev. A, 035 Rev. A  received 14th January /2013 and 8578-EX- 001-Rev. A, 002 Rev. A, 016; 8578-PP- 020 Rev. A, 030 Rev. B,  036 received 14th March 2013, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2005, or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification),  the retail/ office units hereby approved shall not be amalgamated/ subdivided without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.    REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the vitality and viability of the Southall Town Centre, in accordance with section 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 2.13, 2.15, 2.16, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan 2011, policy 7.2 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (a) (c) (d), 1.2 (c), 2.1 (c), 2.8 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy and policies Ealing Local variation to London Plan policy 4.7, Ealing local variation to London Plan policy 7.4 of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | The external materials of the development shall match the appearace of  those in the existing building.  REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the building and  the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 7 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 2.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy and policy 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | Notwithstanding any information provided in this application, detailed plans of the shopfronts facing South Road hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences. The details shall be implemented as approved.  REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the building and  the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 7 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 2.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy and policy 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | The retail units and the car park hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 0730 to 2000 on Monday to Saturday and 0730 to 1700 on Sundays and Public Holidays. The office units hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 0730 to 2000 on Monday to Saturday, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. REASON: To safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway safety, in accordance with section 4 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11, 6.13, 7.1, 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.10 and 9.1 of the Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004) and policies 1.1 (e)  (j), , 2.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and  policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | The car parking area hereby approved shall only be used to serve the needs of the development hereby approved and for no other purpose, unless agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority through the submission of an application for full planning permission.  REASON: To safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway safety, in accordance with section 4 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11, 6.13, 7.1, 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.10 and 9.1 of the Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004) and policies 1.1 (e)  (j), , 2.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and  policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the parking and servicing area hereby approved shall only be accessed/egressed via the west most access along Beaconsfield Road. The parking area and internal circulation shall be completed and marked out on-site as approved prior to first occupation of any part of the development.   REASON: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety in neighbouring highways, in accordance with section 4 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (f) and policy Ealing local variation to London Plan policy 6.13 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | The development hereby approved shall not be brought into use until the surplus crossover (eastern most) along Beaconsfield Road providing access into the site has been removed and the kerb and the pavement at this location re-instated.  REASON: In pursuance to highway users safety in accordance with section 4 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (f) and policy Ealing local variation to London Plan policy 6.13 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | A detailed 'operational plan' for the retail element hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include details of deliveries and collections, loading/ unloading places, manouverability, size of vehicles and frequency of deliveries. The serivicng of the retail units  must be operated in accordance with the approved "operational plan" thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety in neighbouring highways, in accordance with section 4 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (f) and policy Ealing local variation to London Plan policy 6.13 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | Notwithstanding any details submitted in this application, any new external lighting scheme to serve the car parking and servicing area hereby approved shall be in operation before the first occupation of any part of the development. It shall be in compliance with the Institution of Lighting Engineers and Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution particularly with regards to:   (i) reducing glare by  - Correctly aiming the luminaries to avoid impacts on neighbouring properties  - Using luminaires designed so that the glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit  - Ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees.  (ii)  controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating as required by BS5489 with a uniformity rating that does not fall below 0.25Uo and the colour rendering qualities of the lamps used must achieve a minimum of 60Ra (60%) on the colour rendering index.  REASON:  To protect the working and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, the visual appearance of the area and in pursuance to community safety in accordance with Section 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and policies 1.1 (e) (h) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and policy Ealing Local variation to London Plan policy 7.3 of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | No amplified sound or other music shall be played in the car parking and servicing area hereby approved. REASON: In the interests of the living and working conditions of nearby occupiers and users of the Town Centre in accordance with policy  7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.10 of the Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration', policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the refuse/ recycling storage area shown on approved plan no 8578-PP-030 Rev B to demonstrate separate provision between retail/ office uses hereby approved is made along with a refuse management plan shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of any part of the development. The approved details shall be made fully avaliable before the first occupation of the development hereby approved.  REASON: To safeguard the working/living environment of neighbouring properties and in the interests of the environment and the streetscene, in accordance with policy 7.4 of The London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004),  Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | No display of goods for sale or any other use shall be carried out in the forecourt area fronting South Road and Beaconsfield Road. REASON: In the interests of the visual amenity of the Town Centre and pedestrian safety  in accordance with policy  7.5 of the London Plan 2011, policies 9.1 of the Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004), policy 1.1 (e) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and policy 7A and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application, details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced to demonstrate the development shall be accessible for disabled people.   REASON:	In the interest of accessibility in accordance with section 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7.2  of the London Plan 2011, policy 4.3  of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1 (h) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026. | The financial and professional services (A2 use class)  office space shall be provided at ground floor and the  business office space (B1a  use class) shall be provided at first floor only.  REASON: In the interests of the viability and vitality of the Southall Town Centre in accordance with section 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 4.1, 4.2 and 4.7 of the London Plan 2011, policies 7.2 of the Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004), policy 1.1 (d) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and policy 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013).
